other_tests.findings: A retrocecal appendix is identified in the right lower quadrant, which is abnormally distended and fluid-filled, measuring 20 mm in maximal diameter. The appendiceal wall is circumferentially thickened and surrounded by periappendiceal fat stranding and edema. A small amount of fluid is noted lateral and posterior to the appendix, suspicious for possible early perforation. No abscess is identified.
